author: markt
msg: Separate the return type (which must be an object) from the expected type which may be a primitive. This is necessary for EL 3.0 onwards as the default handling of nulls is now different for primitives and objects. The expression engine needs to know what the true expected type is in order to correctly coerce the result to the right type.

author: thomasm
msg: OAK-890 Query: advanced fulltext search conditions (remove old code)

msg: fixing the issue when there is no input for a node
